content.description: This has a surprise, OW crux up high after some ticky tacky stemming on small, flaring fingers.
content.location: This is located directly up the trail from the Junior Olympic Wall on the Opening Ceremony Wall to the left of where it meets the trail.  Start on a slab in a left-facing corner.

content.description: Climb an easy face to a high first bolt (don't fall!) and a good stance under the huge roof.  Reach out and clip the bolt under the roof (note: there are 2 bolts sitting inches away from each other; one of them is very loose).  Get your body completely horizontal under the roof and make a big throw to a great jug at the lip of the roof.  If you're 5'10" or shorter, your feet will cut loose!  Clip the 3rd bolt and make one more big move to establish yourself on the face above.  Easier climbing on great incuts past 1 more bolt will get you to the anchors.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on Opening Ceremony Wall.  Start below the huge roof; it is impossible to miss.

climbs.name: Batter Up
climbs.fa: E. Carman, M. Carman, T. Perkins, 1996

content.description: Climb a face for two bolts, then move up into a discontinuous crack and a few more bolts to the bottom of a roof.  Execute the oddball, lip encounter crux, and clip the anchors.
content.location: This is in the middle of the Opening Ceremony Wall about 20' right of a hip high, flat boulder that sits near the base.
